column4: Is it me or there is something wrong with how ubuntu manages memory? I have 2GB RAM. After some time my memory is full, and everything freezes or crashes
is an application taking all of the memory?
check in system monitor, memory tab

Yes. Applications are taking memory. I'm trying to run firefox and some other things like IDE, and it grows and grows in memory and freezes system. Ubunt can't clear it. Only sometimes it will kill random processes.
which applications are taking memory?
how much memory does the application take?
what is your swap memory size?
well now it looks like one tab in chrome is taking 450MB, firefox is taking 300mb ...
I can disable them but it will grow anyway in few hours
yes
If i run virtualbox or rubymine ide i will kill my system now
i'm not sure too if i got swap, there is none in system monitor
what is the output of 'free' in a terminal then?
and swap?
does swapon -a enable swap?
swapon -a in terminal does nothing?
is there a swap partition then? sudo fdisk -l
is there one judging from the output from sudo fdisk -l?
do you have pastebinit installed?
ok.
there isn't much reason to run firefox and chrome at the same time though
terry: http://pastebin.com/jgTxTvs7
